newsitem.title: USA: Fla. to seek federal disaster aid after Josephine.
newsitem.headline: Fla. to seek federal disaster aid after Josephine.

text.p: Florida will seek federal government disaster aid in the wake of Tropical Storm Josephine, according to a state official.
Damage assessment teams made up of federal, state and local officials are assessing damage in the state to support a request for a presidential disaster declaration, he said.

"This process is a crucial part of helping Florida's storm victims," said Joe Myers, director of the division of emergency management, in a statement. "Gathering this information to support a request for a presidential declaration and the need for federal assistance is key to recovering over the long term."

Teams were expected to visit 14 counties -- Baker, Citrus, Clay, Dixie, Duval, Hernando, Hillsborough, Levy, Manatee, Pasco, Pinellas, Putnam, Taylor and Volusia. Additional counties might be added to that list.
